attributes.comment:
I am writing in regard to U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services, Docket
Number USCIS-2006-0044.

I would like to express my concern over the proposed increase in fees related
the adoption of foreign-born children. Of special concern is the increase in
fees for I-600/600A, N-565 and N-600.

The proposed increases represent a major increase to the existing fees. Many
people undertaking the adoption process will be affected by not only one but
perhaps all three of these fee increases. The total increase for these three
fees is over 30%.

While I understand the need for increases due to passage of time or due to new
security regulations these increases seem out of line for those requirements.
Especially considering the fees associated with the I-600and I-600A are being
paid by United States citizens in the process of adopting.

Further raising the fees for the N-600 and N-565 not only places a burden on
parents adopting children (who wish to have the child?s name changed), it also
places a burden on persons attempting to become citizens or who have become
citizens but have lost or destroyed their previous certificates. It especially
places a burden on women who may wish to change their name at the time of marriage.

With the recent debate regarding immigration it seems counterproductive to make
it more difficult for persons to follow the rules and to use the legal process.

In closing while understand the need for fee increases as needed these increases
seem excessive. I urge you to reconsider these increases and the burden that
they will place on families and people who wish to become citizens of this great
country.

Thank you
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Stacie Lucero
